group_1.progressNarration: [textBlack:What became of that fierce battle]@[textBlack:in Futatsugi City? Alas, its conclusion]@[textBlack:is not in my memory.]
[textBlack:Thinking not of myself,]@[textBlack:I protected the girls of Promised Blood,]@[textBlack:and when I came to,]@[textBlack:I was in a hospital bed.]

[textBlack:Only upon seeing my mother in tears and]@[textBlack:hearing Rii-chan's explanation did I realize]@[textBlack:I truly had been on the verge of death,]@[textBlack:and my heart wrenched with regret.]

[textBlack:Bedridden as I was, I was unable to move]@[textBlack:my body as much as I would have liked,]@[textBlack:so I had to ask others about everyone's]@[textBlack:state of affairs. I learned that there were]@[textBlack:more developments among the Magical Girls]@[textBlack:than just the battle with Promised Blood.]
[textBlack:What came next was an inevitable event]@[textBlack:that caused the Magical Girls to be divided]@[textBlack:into two major groups.]

group_1.textLeft: So the battle for Promised Blood's survival@begins in Futatsugi.

group_1.textRight: That's right.
There's people there who can fight while getting@around the [textYellow:Kimochis]' rules.
And they don't gotta worry about our home lives@or money there, so it's the best move they've got.

group_1.textLeft: As well as a desperate, last-ditch gamble to right@a sinking ship.

group_1.textRight: Ugh...
More people are probably gonna die again...

group_1.textLeft: Indeed...
The Tokime Clan also seeks to destroy@Promised Blood,
and therefore have already decided to travel to@Futatsugi.

group_1.textRight: Hey, Rabi...
If there are more deaths and things get worse,@the clock's hands will advance...right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes.
And those who will push it yet further are still@waiting in the wings.

group_1.textRight: You mean Neo-Magius, right?

group_1.textLeft: They are the ones who will not hesitate to@sacrifice others.
Thus the hands of resignation shall move onward.
In addition, if Touka Satomi, Nayuta Satomi,@Nemu Hiiragi, or Kagome Satori...
...are among the victims, then we can assume@the clock has struck midnight.

group_1.textRight: If they're... That would include Hime, too,@wouldn't it?
She's trying to do the same thing...

group_1.textLeft: Correct.
Speaking of which, how goes the situation with@Neo-Magius?

group_1.textRight: Bit by bit, they've been steadily gnawing away@at the other factions...
They've been moving faster ever since the@instructor joined them.
It may only be a matter of time before the other@groups are impacted.

group_1.textLeft: After the battle with Promised Blood is over,
and Neo-Magius is in full swing,
I think that will be the time for you to withdraw@from them.
The decision, however, is ultimately yours@to make.

group_1.textRight: ...Alright.
Am I permitted to pursue the others into this@battle?
Yeah, if things go south, I've got someone@I wanna protect, too.

group_1.textLeft: If our acting freely could disrupt the Awakening@at its source,
it'd hardly be something worth believing in@to begin with.

group_1.textRight: So then...

group_1.textLeft: I'm not going to stop you, and you don't have@to try to stop me.
You're free to do as you will.

group_1.textRight: Thank you.

group_1.textLeft: I have just one request to make:
I don't want Nayuta involved in this.

group_1.textRight: I heard you mentioning her name earlier.
You're going to build a rift between her and@Touka, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes.
She and Touka Satomi banded together@to spread the truth of Magical Girls.
But thanks to the professor being captured, I was@given the opportunity to splinter that relationship.
I have my regrets, but my actions were the only@way to prevent her death.

group_1.textRight: It will be difficult to act until this final battle@is over, however.

group_1.textLeft: Until then, I'll try to shake her faith even more,
in hopes that her suspicion of Touka being@an enemy will turn to surety...
